text.text_translated:
An earthquake is when the ground shakes a lot.
Earthquakes can break buildings and bridges.
Luckily, bridges do not fall down very often.
This is especially true for new bridges.
Engineers design bridges for places with many earthquakes.
They choose strong ground, so the bridge does not move much.

feedback.feedback: FAIL: Meaning Preservation Failure. The MeaningBERT score of 0.6976 is below the required 0.75, showing that the core message about engineers designing on ground resistant to movement is weakened. FAIL: Fidelity Failure. The BERTScore of 0.8983 is below the required 0.90, indicating loss of key phrasing such as “areas that are much more resistant to movement” and “relatively infrequent” used in the original. Suggestion: Restore the phrase “relatively infrequent” to describe modern bridge collapse frequency. Suggestion: Include the concept of designing on “areas that are much more resistant to movement” to match the original message more closely.

best_attempt.text_translated:
An earthquake is when the ground shakes a lot.
Earthquakes can break buildings and bridges.
Luckily, bridges do not fall down very often.
This is especially true for new bridges.
Engineers design bridges for places with many earthquakes.
They choose strong ground, so the bridge does not move much.
